answers.answer: I am not a physician but the mom of a type one and the daughter of a type 2 diabetic.   I would suggest you contact your endocronologist, even though the lack of exercise could be adding to your lethargic feeling it could also because by other factors.If your thyroid is not working properly (which can happen with diabetics of both types) you can be very lethargic and gain weigh easily.  I know this first had.  I had a problem and I was constantly exhausted and gained weight very easily.  I was put on medication and I felt like a new person.I have not done Pilates, but friends that have say it really works.Also exceecise will help keep your bloodsugars down and your energy level u.Good luck

Well - I have used the Windsor Pilates for quite some time now.  It helps me stay away from those moments where "cheating" seems okay and also helps to keep me feeling active during the day and evening times.The weight loss/gain really depends upon your work structure and the foods/frequency/amount your eating.I think with each meal I eat because I am a type 1 diabetic that I should only be eating about half of what other people eat.  I wait through about 10 minutes of total dissatisfaction of what I just ate and then the feeling of fullness starts to take effect.  While everyone else is feeling sick because they ate too much, I feel just right and am ready to rock and roll.I dont know if this helps at all.Keep up the exercise and remember that as a fellow diabetic I know how hard it is to not cheat, but everynow and then we can have a little something.
